About Me

Hello! I'm Adam Papis, an aspiring full-stack web developer with a keen eye for creating engaging digital experiences. My journey in the world of web development began during my time at Aberystwyth University, where I pursued a BSc in Business Information Technology. My academic path wasn't just about books and lectures; it was a deep dive into practical, hands-on experiences that honed my skills in JavaScript, SCSS, React, and I'm currently delving into the intricacies of .NET.

My professional adventure started at Artworking, a creative hub where we crafted bespoke websites for golf clubs. Here, I didn't just develop websites; I contributed to a spectrum of projects that sharpened my skills in design, client interactions, and technical troubleshooting. My role as a Junior Web Developer was a blend of creativity and technical prowess, utilizing WordPress, JavaScript, and Sass to bring our clients' visions to life

Though not my primary occupation, freelancing has offered me the opportunity to tackle diverse projects, enhancing my versatility and reinforcing my problem-solving prowess. These experiences, while sporadic, have been invaluable, providing me with unique insights and a broader perspective on web development.

Beyond the screen, I'm a globe-trotter at heart. Last year, my adventures took me to the vibrant cultures of Spain and Italy, experiences that broadened my horizons and infused my work with fresh perspectives.

As I wrap up my final project at university—a cutting-edge restaurant management app—I'm eager to embark on the next chapter of my career. With a toolkit brimming with the latest web technologies and a relentless drive to grow, I'm ready to dive into new challenges and contribute to dynamic teams.
